description.narrative: For Sugu Women Group aims to protect and preserve the environment in the farming community of Sugu in northwestern Ghana. The people in Sugu grow cash crops and keep livestock, and are thus entirely dependent on the environment for their livelihoods. Small scale mining is now spreading across the community, destroying land and creating deep holes and pollution that pose threats to children and domestic animals and make it more difficult to cultivate their crops. While men and children view the situation as less problematic (because they are the ones who work the mines), women are concerned about land degradation and health issues. The organization strives to minimize and hopefully stop the extent of land degradation due to mining and thereby protect land for agriculture. An awarenss raising campaign will be conducted in the area that will involve around 300 women, 250 men, and 100 youth
